item.title: Right to repair, why you should care?
item.description: E-waste Link to heading Once upon a time, any electronics you bought would come with a schematic documenting it’s inner workings. Not only are these official schematics almost impossible to obtain due to “information secrets”, try to disassemble any electronic device and you will be met with a bunch of roadblocks; excessive use of adhesive, non-modular/soldered parts and requirement of proprietary tools. Apple even invented a mechanically inferior screw called the pentalope screw just to keep people out of their hardware.
